Interested in being an organizer?.answer: Applications to be an organizer open around September–October at the beginning of the school year before Bitcamp!

Where can I find last year’s recap?.answer: You can find last year’s recap here. (include recap video or media)

Feedback form for hackers.answer: A Google Form will be provided.

What/When is Bitcamp?.answer: Bitcamp falls in the 2nd week of April and takes place from Friday–Saturday.

What's a hackathon?.answer: A hackathon is a time-bound event where individuals or teams collaborate to solve a problem, usually by creating a working prototype or product.

Do I have to be experienced to attend?.answer: No, beginners are welcome and encouraged!

Is it okay if I don't have an idea or te.answer: Yes! We will have a team formation event to help you find teammates.

Can I attend if I don't want to hack?.answer: Of course! There will be workshops, events, and networking opportunities.

How else can I get involved?.answer: You can organize or host a workshop during Bitcamp weekend.

How do I join a team?.answer: Teams of 1–4 can be formed before or at Bitcamp and will be shown on Devpost.

How competitive is the application?.answer: There is no application to attend Bitcamp as a hacker.

Who can apply to organize Bitcamp?.answer: Any UMD undergraduate student may apply—no experience required!

Is Bitcamp free?.answer: Yes! Bitcamp is fully free to attend.

Can non-registered people attend?.answer: Yes. After a designated time, walk-ins may pick up waitlist numbers and may enter depending on capacity.

What have people made in the past?.answer: You can check out last year’s projects here <Devpost link>.

Do I need to wear a mask?.answer: Masks are not required unless you have an infectious illness.

How many people per team?.answer: Up to 4 people can form a team.

Can I leave the venue and come back?.answer: Yes, as long as you have your wristband signifying you checked in.

How does judging work?.answer: Judging occurs during Expo and is conducted by organizers or sponsors.

Where can I sleep?.answer: You may sleep sitting up at your desk, but lying down is not allowed due to safety concerns.

What is the WiFi password?.answer: Use UMD Guest WiFi, or Eduroam if you’re a UMD student.

Are snacks available?.answer: Yes, there will be a food table during the weekend.
